title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA)
Interview Descriptions: The process was relatively quick with good communication of the steps, timeline and people I would meet. It was a three step process beginning with a phone screening, then a meeting with the hiring manager and then a final panel interview with the team.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know about my interest in the mission and my personal faith.

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: A lot of legal jargon in regards to same-sex marriage. Interview lasted about an hour (a little long for an initial interview). I was frustrated there was no follow-up from recruiter after they expressed great interest to me.
Interview Questions: How big of a team you like to work on?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: The overall process was rather quick, but involved 17 individuals - recruiter, supervisor, and panels of peers, and direct reports. It was summer so the office seemed a bit sparse, but I later learned that's also because people travel a lot.
Interview Questions: Asked about how my faith motivated me.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: A phone screen, 1:1 with the hiring manager, and then additional requests which I never completed due to time and personal reasons. In my opinion the process was too long and the references required were going to ask personal questions about how precious employers experienced your expression of faith which I just wasn’t comfortable with. Not LGBTQ friendly in the slightest.
Interview Questions: Describe your faith life and history, how active are you in your church?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight forward and their questions aligned with the job description. Some people have asked me about how religious WV is. My response is that they will ask you about your personal relationship with Jesus in the interview. It's actually in many of the JD's as well.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you made a mistake.

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very organized and efficient at WV. I really enjoyed meeting the team and they asked very good questions. I learned a lot about that culture in the process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at World Vision?

title: Christmas Promoter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: I completed the initial online application, which included submitting my resume, and was accepted into the group interview. This interview was held with about 7 other candidates, going through World Vision's mission, the role of the promoter and different exercises to practice promoting sponsorships. In the end, only 4 roles were offered and we found out at the end of the group interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult customer?

title: Senior Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at World Vision USA in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough! Phone screening and then 3 rounds of interviews. Be prepared to have a spiritual reference and share your testimony/beliefs. They do call all references. I met with 6 total people from start to finish of the interview process.
Interview Questions: If a Facebook ad gets a 1% CTR, is that good or bad? Why? What is your experience working with agencies and other teams?

title: Contracts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: several interviews  with different people. First an interview with HR, then an phone interview with the manager, then a team interview over the phone then a team interview in person.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for WV? Personality questions etc.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: This was a great interview process from start to end where I got to learn more about the role and work community as an intern. I interned for a summer.
Interview Questions: What school do you currently attend?

title: Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Washington, DC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interview rounds, pretty standard. Everyone seemed very nice and the process went very well for me. However, when it came to the salary offer they offered me $15k less than what I stated was a minimum, after previously saying they could afford my minimum. It was honestly insulting and they wasted my time. Not only was it $15k less, the benefits were not great. To add more context, this position would have been a managerial role (my previous role was a specialist) with more demanding work...yet they will not pay for that work and expertise. What they offered me was actually less than what I make as a specialist.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to get up to speed  and learn quickly in a fast moving environment (especially during COVID-19)?

title: Director of Segment and Product Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Applied via LinkedIn. Recruiter call. Important Note: Unless you are a Christian they will not consider hiring you.

She spent most of the time telling me about the role and what the manager is looking for. Her only two questions for me were 1. What is your salary needs. 2. Are you Christian. 

It's required for getting a job here. If you are a Jew, Muslim, Buddhist, etc... you are unwelcome in their organization. Crazy that this level of prejudice is going on. I told her I respect and support all in their religious beliefs, but that isn't enough -- you need to a follower of Jesus.
Interview Questions: Are you a Christian?

title: Donor Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: A phone call interview and then a panel interview in the office building with the same person who gave you the phone interview. They also have you do a computer test to see how you would do using something similar to their system.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with escalated situations?

title: Clinical Supervisor MHPSS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: Challenging.The people were friendly,encouraging and firm.There was a panel from the human resource,psychology department,christian commitment and research representatives.In total about 15 people were present at the interview.There are three stages.
Interview Questions: If i can get a letter from my pastor

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Washington, DC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two stage interview, one with the recruiter/ hr in Federal Way and the other with the hiring manager. very easy and nothing out of the blues. They were both very friendly. I interviewed in July and fot a response in August 2018
Interview Questions: Are you a christian? Why do you want to work at WV

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience. Interviewed with a panel, and then the process took about 3 weeks, but it was an amazing experience and the questions where also not to hard.
Interview Questions: experience with healthcare

title: Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied just as applications were posted, so had to wait a month or so to hear back about an interview. Started with phone screen with recruiter then a few days later I had an interview with former manager.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Senior Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions:
1) Written : Arrange a written test and Viva-Voce for the candidate.
2) Planing capacity: Tell him/her to make 5 years plan, How to Coordination the plan  and how to Implement the plan
3) Budget making capacity: How much money need to achieve the project goal along with appropriate time frame. 
4) Report writing capacity: Periodical and annual report writing ability.
Interview Questions: What is Planning?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is lengthy, 3 pages of behavior questions.  You really have to be prepared and practice your answers well and have lots of examples and stories to tell.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you manage a project and how did you go about doing it?

title: Senior Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Did a recruitment screen and hiring manager call and a supplemental application where I had to scramble to secure professional & spiritual references . Hiring manager corrected me about how I should be explaining my background in interviews. I regret the time I spent looking for a role at this company.
Interview Questions: Explain your relationship with Jesus

title: Project Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Apparently the recruitment team there gets far more applications than they have jobs avail. They are slow and unresponsive unless you know somebody on the inside.  Seems like "recruiting" is the wrong title. Should be "screening" department.
Interview Questions: Ask if you are a Christian.  They won't hire you if you aren't.  Even if you are a Christian, note that hey don't hire LGBT, not even Christian ones.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at World Vision USA in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Too many interviews, unclear hiring and promotions process, "panel" interviews with non-active/non-adjacent staff members.  Frequently the interview process is very long and there is very little sense of urgency on WV's part. Plan to stick it out for a long period of time if you really want the job. Also, actually getting from the phone screen to the in-person interview is a very good sign, it's common to only interview 2-3 candidates for a position.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions. Tell us about a difficult situation and how you resolved it, tell us about why you are interested in this position, tell us why you would be good at this job. Questions about strategic planning, but very few that allowed any actual productive dialogue on real day to day job function. Many people leave interviews still very unclear on what a particular job actually entails.

title: Senior Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, thoughtful, great with follow-up. The recruiter was diligent in getting back to me and didn't make promises she couldn't keep. Everyone on the interview panel was well-prepared and asked me extremely thoughtful questions and were open and honest with me when I asked them questions.
Interview Questions: How would you plan to spend your first 90 days?

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: A very lengthy five step interview process where you are interviewed by the recruiter, hr, position manager, team, and then finally a skills test. They are extremely thorough and want to have the best possible fit.
Interview Questions: why do you believe you'd be a good fit at world vision

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: The process consisted of a Questionnaire and straightforward questions. Everything was electronic at first. After the flushing out via the electronic process, then the  one on one stuff begins. I would prepare by reviewing the background info of the company and understand the principles. Because this organization stands for Christian tenants, I would only apply if your values match those mentioned. If not, I would not pursue because there will most likely be a clash later.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experiences in relation to the 6 core values.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted application online and received an email arranging a phone interview 3 days after. Phone interview lasted for an hour and a half. In-house recruiter took time to explain the role first and also gave a salary range to ensure that I was OK with a salary that was slightly below market for the role. He then proceeded to review my qualifications and asked me about various experiences in my resume.

I was then called back for an onsite interview at their headquarters in WA State. Met with a panel of 3 interviews. Hiring Manager was one of the 3 and was interviewing remotely via teleconference. They went through an interview script.

I was impressed with the professionalism of the recruiter and the interviewing panel. Even though I did not receive an offer, they took the trouble to call back and gave me very positive feedback on the interview.
Interview Questions:
What most interests you about your work?

What kind of learner are you?

World Vision is a Christian organization and staff do need to profess the Christian faith. How comfortable are you with that?

World Vision also works cross-culturally and the role will require you to deal with people of many different cultures and backgrounds. How comfortable are you with that?

title: Senior Business Analyst/Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was very responsive and the entire interview process was very efficient.  I had a phone interview with the recruiter.  She was very helpful to prepare me for the actual interview.  During the actual on site interview, the panel interviews was very relational and the interviewers made me feel comfortable and not intimidated at all.
Interview Questions: What do you consider a good project manager and a good BA?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: long interview process despite the fact that I was told my experience was faster than normal.   The focus of the process is on your ability to comply with the written statement of faith.   Initial interviews are with HR rep (I had 3 such interviews before meeting the actual person I would work with)
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with the statement of faith and leading prayer?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: 1-2 phone interviews (since most applicants are from various locations across the US). First phone interview is conducted with recruiter. Second round of phone interviews is conducted with the manager/team that the intern would potentially work under. Sometimes an applicant will be interviewed by multiple departments to find the best fit.
Interview Questions: Asked questions regarding work experience and interests (in order to determine if intern is qualified and find best fit for department that the internship would be under).

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: A breeze - you just have to answer the questions and speak from your experience.  The only issue is that you interview with a lot of people. You may be asked about your faith background and about what church you attend.
Interview Questions: Do you know to use Lotus Notes? Tell us about your past experience.  Tell us how you handle stressful situation?  Tell us about your faith.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: Two steps, first was recruitment and the next was to speak directly with the hiring manager that I would work under. It was straight forward, with details given in both interviews, but a heavier emphasis on the role and my background an qualifications during the second interview.
Interview Questions: The questions were uncomplicated and it was  essentially centred on my understanding of the role and my experience in relation to it. Not many behavioural questions, more competency or performance based, but pretty technical in nature.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three phone interviews and one panel interview. Most questions were difficult to answer. The interview really didn't reveal the true nature of the job or the reporting structure of the department.
Interview Questions: Do I have a problem with an open workspace

title: Management Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Company used a search firm, which was not very sophisticated. Onsite interviews went well. I interviewed with several managers individually, as well as a group interview. Employees of the organization were extremely gracious, approachable, and appeared to enjoy working for World Vision. The organizational culture is steep in christian values. There were lots of prayers, references to biblical scriptures, and a genuine desire to convey a positive image of the organization. Another aspect of the culture is a seemingly aversion to change. My sense is some employees do not believe change will strengthen the organizational culture and/or increase its level of effectiveness and success.
Interview Questions: What do you know about World Vision?

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: A week after submitting an application, I have taken the online exam (excel, word, formatting a letter  in 2 hours). After another week, I took two rounds of interview at their office. The fist interview was with human resource and department, and the second (last) interview was with the representative.
Interview Questions: My previous experience, my motivation regarding why I'd like to work in development assistance and how far I know about the organization, whether I agree with their organization's mission as a non-christian, how long I'd like to work with them (although the position was a year contract, they seemed to look for a person who could engage longer), how I see myself after ten years, etc. It lasted about an hour each.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called within a few weeks to schedule a phone interview. The phone interview was just standard prequalification questions. Within a week or so, I was called to schedule the next step of the interview process. This step lasted a few hours and was a great opportunity to get to know the department manager and hear more about the position. The next step was a group interview and a little daunting because it was a big group and not knowing what to expect, but after 15 minutes or so, I relaxed a bit and enjoyed getting to know the interviewers. Each step of the way I could feel the strong Christian emphasis, but wasn't required to pray for the group during the  interview or anything like that. Typical process with each step, right up to the job offer. The onboarding process was an online system called Red Carpet, if I remeber correctly, and was a little bit confusing at first but I liked it when all requiremeets were completed.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult.

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview experience with several different teams of individuals; some technical questions; mostly basic questions about prior experience and familiarity with specific technologies. Many of the folks were not particularly friendly, but professional enough. Not the best interview experience, but not terrible either.
Interview Questions: Describe your familiarity with SQL databases

title: Senior Finance Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Washington, DC) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviews by HR Specialist and then two weeks later by a team of 6 panelists. Proceeded to the third interview with the VP and Senior Director. That was last time they spoke to me. Tried to follow-up and never got a feedback, not even the courtesy to tell me I was never successful. Left me with a question, did this reflect World Vision Values? This was in 2015.
Interview Questions: How did you get here?

title: Senior Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submission of application to search firm, followed by initial conversation with search firm principal who provides position overview and supporting documentation of the role. Next step was phone interview with search firm to determine fit for role and guage mutual interest. Candidates then are narrowed to short list. Short list is interviewed via a video-taped session (1:1 by search firm). This video is viewed by the panel and that is narrowed to 1 individual they select to bring in for in-person interviews. If that person is successful, they hire them. If not, they go back to the short list and try again.
Interview Questions: The interview for video consisted of 1 hour overview of work history/experience.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and they were able to email me back after several weeks. I had to go through two rounds of interview. Both were done by phone since I did not live near the location of the company. For the first one, I was able to interview with a recruiter. This interview consists mostly of question about things on resume. After the interview was over, she told me she would get back to me in a couple of weeks if there was a position that matched my skills and interests. For my second interview, I was able to interview with my potential manager. Most of this interview was about my working style and a couple of questions about my experiences on my resume.
Interview Questions: Questions weren't really that difficult. Most of them were pretty generic, about your weaknesses and strengths etc.

title: Senior Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: Applied for position online. Got an email for a phone interview with the recruiter. A week later went in to the office to Skype interview with hiring manager. A week later met with hiring manager and panel interivew with team. Everyone I met with was really nice. Had a great experience. Wish things would have turned in my favor.
Interview Questions: All questions were basic. Nothing out of the ordinary

title: Global Development Policy- Washington, D C Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Washington, DC) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an email within a week to set up an interview. Typical preliminary interview with a very friendly HR director. Asked general questions research experience and past projects. Asked to talk about my Christian faith and my goals in working with World Vision. Relaxed Interview. Received another email within a week to set up an interview with a couple Senior Policy Advisors. Very friendly. Asked more specific questions about relevant skills, knowledge, and experiences. I was offered the position the same day.
Interview Questions: Normal interview questions. No trick questions. Be prepared to explain and talk about the relevant skills and experiences that you've listed on your resume.

title: Donor Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then received a call from the HR person. She interviewed me over the phone. She asked me to give my statement of faith and asked general interview questions about availability and what are my strengths and weaknesses. I was then asked to come to a sit down interview where the questions were about the same. After I was hired I completed paperwork and went on to the 13 week training class.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your walk with Christ.

title: Program Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took 2 months. Background check and reference check required. In person interview consisted of a panel of four people who asked a series of questions per scoring criteria.
Interview Questions: What attracts you most to this position?

title: Design and Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: HR phone screen plus six interviews over two days.
Interview Questions:
Interview process was grueling and repetitive. Met perhaps 15 or 16 people.   Questions repeated so often that I wondered if it would have been easier to have a polygraph machine attached. 

10 minutes of each hour long interview was dedicated to asking me about my Christian faith. As a baptized but not overly devout Catholic, I was wary about this. I told them that I had no problem with one weekly prayer. 

Worst part was the meltdown in the final interview by a prospective colleague. I asked a work choice/ workload-related question and then she fully snapped, going off on me... It became obvious that they were overworked very badly.

title: Domestic Programs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called within a week for a phone screen interview with HR. A week later they called and told me over the phone I didn't advance to the next interview round. I think they were being professional with the personal phone call, but if I didn't get the job I prefer a personal email.
Interview Questions: World Vision is definitely a Christian organization and sharing your faith is a part of the interview.

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Vision USA
Interview Descriptions: It is long, monotonous and unnecessary for positions that pay well below market salaries.  It touts itself as a Christian organization and goes through great lengths to verify that you are one even wanting to contact your Pastor. However, when you finally get in front of the hiring managers there is nothing Christian about them, it is very corporate and they are just protecting their cushy jobs and looking for the fit that will keep them in their cushy jobs where they do nothing to save the company money for the children they claim to represent and care about.  Just a typical fake Non-Profit that has lost it's way.  It seems the Leadership is not leading and has no clue what is happening in their organization, probably to busy raising money..
Interview Questions: There are so many I would say their whole Questionnaire and interview questions.

title: Senior Data Solutions & Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 interviews for this position; the first one a phone interview.   I was very impressed by the thoroughness of the interviewing process and the professionalism of the interviewing staff.   I also sentenced a great respect and adherence to the companies Christian philosophy which I really admired.
Interview Questions: Describe how you moved from one job role to the next with your former employer.

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Washington, DC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I think I interviewed with something like 17 people before it was all said and done. Nearly all were panel interviews and many of the questions repeated themselves. This grew annoying and I wondered whether they communicated with one another when setting up the questions and receiving the answers. I believe there has been work to improve this situation, but they still like lots of buy in on hires so numerous panel interviews seem to be standard.
Interview Questions: WV can always be counted on to ask questions about your faith and how it informs your work and life. These are reasonable questions for a Christian organization, but as an organization that claims to embrace the breadth of Christianity from Eastern Orthodox to Evangelical, it still has a very strong evangelical feel which can be off putting for some.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one with the hiring manager and the second with the team
Interview Questions: Nothing unordinary, a lot of behavioral questions

title: Marketing and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter for an interview after an online job application. I was interviewed by the Recruiter and the Department Lead. They asked me questions about my job experience and asked to see my portfolio. All in all, the interview process was painless. I did have to contact them to get a decision back.
Interview Questions: They did want me to talk about my relationship with God. Although I knew to expect that, I wasn't sure if my answer was sufficient.

title: Marketing Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at World Vision USA in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called for an interview a couple of weeks later. The recruiter who called me was very nice. I interviewed at the Federal Way headquarters and got a chance to tour the visitor center before my interview to learn more about the company. I would recommend that to anyone who is thinking of working there. I interviewed with a recruiter as well as the department lead. All in all, the interview was pretty easy.
Interview Questions: They really didn't ask me anything out of the ordinary. I knew they were going to ask me about my faith in Jesus which would have thrown me off initially. But I knew they were going to ask it so I was prepared.

title: Donor Services Representative Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: There were two total interviews: 1 phone interview and 1 in-person interview. Both consisted of standard behavioral questions. Both were very easy. The in-person interview included a tour of the building containing the call center (high ceiling with short cubicles so you can see everyone; pleasant atmosphere). The entire process was about 1 hour.
Interview Questions: There truly was not any unexpected question. Just prepare with standard behavioral interview questions (a challenge you encountered previously and how you overcame it, how would you deal with a difficult donor interaction without manager available, etc.).

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: 40 minute Phone Screening with HR.  2 one hour panel interview with managers. Waiting for HR to finish up reference checks took awhile.  It is understanding though, sometime that part is a lot of phone tag.  Be sure your references know that you need them to take the call because if missed it can be awhile for HR to reach out again.
Interview Questions: Do you have a issues with praying at work?

title: DCS Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: World Vision takes on-line applications only. After about 3 weeks they called me for a phone interview. About 2 weeks later I was given a one on one interview, and about 2 weeks later a job offer over the phone, followed up by a written offer by mail.
Interview Questions: My reason for wanting to work at World Vision.

title: Communicaitons Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at World Vision USA in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I thought interview went well there a number of questions related to my faith and who Jesus Christ and how often I attended church also there were questions related to how I keep my faith strong and to what level we were involved in at our church.  1st interview seemed to be more focused on where I was coming from with my faith and less about actual job skills.
Interview Questions: Who is Jesus Christ to me

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Small local job fair. Very polite and professional. Met at their Federal Way headquarters and performed interviews for dozens of people.
Interview Questions: Salary.

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at World Vision USA (Federal Way, WA) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial interview with HR and then had 3 additional interviews before I got the job.  Interview questions lead me to believe that there was going to be travel and the job would be a very fun and relaxed environment - (none of which were true in teh end)
Interview Questions: Can you raise $100,000 in on year.
